title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 7 October 2016 - BBC News
summary: health boss makes way for specialist to turn around spiralling deficit .
telford council looks to expand growth fund .
afc telford united sign three players .

documents.title: diana 's will stored in secret warehouse
text: diana 's will stored in secret warehouse

documents.title: west midlands mep to stand for ukip leadership again
text: the west midlands mep bill etheridge has announced he will stand for the ukip leadership again .
one of the favourites , stephen woolfe , has now been discharged from hospital after an altercation with a fellow ukip mep in strasbourg .
with question marks being raised over whether mr woolfe can continue to seek the party leadership , mr etheridge says he can `` no longer '' support his campaign and will now run himself .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: bradford city 2-0 shrewsbury town
text: bradford city 2-0 shrewsbury town

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: headlines : an overcast weekend ahead in shropshire
text: this weekend the weather can be summed up with one word - grey .
it 's forecast to be overcast for the next few days .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : caldwell hopes mellon 's departure could be turning point
text: shrewsbury town 's chief executive , brian caldwell , says he 's spoken to senior players , following the departure of micky mellon and that he hopes this could be a turning point for the football club .
the team travel to second-placed bradford city tomorrow , the only unbeaten side in league one , hoping to end their own run of five games without a win .
goalkeeping coach danny coyne is taking temporary charge for tomorrow 's game .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : oswestry teenager part of ecb side to tour sri lanka
text: a 15-year-old from oswestry has been selected for an english youth team off on a tour of sri lanka in the spring .
the tour has been organised with the help of the ecb to mark the 30th anniversary of the bunbury festival , an event which brings together the country 's top under-15 cricketers .
xavi clarke , who plays for oswestry in the birmingham league is expected to play games in colombo and galle and there are also plans for a game of beach cricket .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: telford council leader on bbc sunday politics
text: telford and wrekin council leader shaun davies will be one of the guests on the couch of bbc sunday politics this weekend , talking about the future of shropshire 's hospitals .
a report leaked last month highlighted shrewsbury as the possible location of a proposed new emergency centre .
it is just one of several reports on the issue and a final decision is not likely to be made in the foreseeable future .
however , politicians and the public across shropshire have been reacting to the likelihood of one of the county 's two a & e units facing a downgrade .
mr davies will be talking to patrick burns on sunday politics from 11:00 on bbc one .

documents.title: wildlife trust gets political debate under way
text: a political debate in shrewsbury , organised by the shropshire wildlife trust is under way , with north shropshire mp owen paterson taking the first question .
he was asked what he thought of fracking and he replied that he would back it as something to buy us time , until a better source of power could be found .
follow the debate on twitter .

documents.title: coyne does not want shrewsbury job
text: coyne does not want shrewsbury job

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : boldly going to a huge star trek convention
text: it 's provided catch phrases which have lasted 50 years .
well , this weekend , fans of star trek will be heading boldly to the nec near birmingham for the european convention .
i 've been along beforehand to meet one of the stars of the show - and you can see more on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Sian Grzeszczyk
Staffordshire Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers meet title rivals milton keynes
text: telford tigers will travel to take on title-rivals milton keynes lightning tomorrow , with the two sides level on points at the top of the epl table .
the lightning will be moving up to the elite league next season , after buying the rights to a franchise in that division and are looking to build a squad capable of competing in the top-flight .
but tigers captain jason silverthorn ( above ) says his players will pay little attention to the league table , especially this early in the season .
the tigers host swindon wildcats on sunday and are likely to welcome back defenceman jonathan weaver after injury .
right now at this stage of the season it is a big game against milton keynes , but that does n't change our process .
the way we will go about things is one game at a time . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : health chief replaced ; council to expand growth fund ; telford sign three players
text: our top stories this evening include :
- shropshire health boss replaced with specialist in financial turnarounds
- council looks to expand growth fund
- afc telford united sign three players
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: council to expand growth fund
text: telford and wrekin council is looking to borrow another £ 30m to boost business in the area .
it has already borrowed £ 20m for its growth fund , which has been used to buy land and property and rent it out to companies looking to set up or expand in telford .
the authority says the fund has already spent £ 14.7m , which has been used to create nearly 1,000 jobs and safeguard another 200 .
and it says its investment so far is expected to bring in £ 400,000 a year in rent , which will be spent on council services in telford .
at a time when we are having to save millions due to cuts in government funding , we are finding new ways to make money .
one of those ways is by further supporting businesses to invest in telford and wrekin .
when a business is successful locally , the whole community will reap the benefits . ''

documents.title: your photos : more photos of autumn scenes around the county
text: you really know autumn is here when you start to see photos like these , sent in by the bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : afc telford united sign three players
text: afc telford united have added three players to their squad this afternoon .
left back ben o'hanlon and striker bradley reid are joining on youth loans from wolverhampton wanderers .
reid spent a short spell with the club last april , but broke his leg over the summer .
telford have also signed paul mccone following his year-long absence through injury and all three should be available to play against bradford park avenue tomorrow .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: wildlife trust to host political debate
text: a political debate is being hosted by the shropshire wildlife trust this evening , aimed at the under-30s .
brexit will be on the agenda and owen paterson , the north shropshire mp , is one of the invited guests .
john hughes from the charity explained that they have a lot of young people come in to work as volunteers and they 've complained about feeling left out of politics .
he also said we should expect to see more of the wildlife trust as a campaigning organisation in the coming years , saying `` we 've got to stand up for wildlife '' .

documents.title: health campaigner angered by ccg leadership change
text: the shropshire health campaigner gill george is not impressed by the latest change at the top of the shropshire clinical commissioning group .
david evans has been replaced as the ccg 's accountable officer after just five months in the job and ms george said the decision had been made `` over the heads of local gps '' .
and she said it proved `` the ccg was failing to drive through nhs cuts on the scale that nhs england demanded '' .
the new appointment , over the heads of local gps and imposed by nhs england , means even less accountability and transparency in the running of our local nhs .
it also reinforces the catastrophic lack of core funding for essential nhs services in our area . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : caretaker manager calls for 'business as normal ' at town
text: the man in temporary charge at shrewsbury town says it 'll be business as normal at the football club today .
following micky mellon 's departure to tranmere , goalkeeping coach danny coyne is preparing the squad for tomorrow 's game at bradford .
coyne is telling the players to forget about the managerial upheaval and concentrate on the match .
we just need to carry on training as professionals , as we all are and approach the game on saturday like we always do . ''

documents.title: headlines : health boss removed ; regimental museum to stay open ; coyne out of running for shrewsbury job
text: a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- shropshire health boss removed to make way for a specialist in tackling the spiralling deficit
- regimental museum to stay open despite funding cut
- coyne rules himself out of running to be new shrewsbury manager
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tenants might have to pay more if ludlow trees are n't felled
text: a shropshire housing association has warned tenants will end up bearing the costs of maintaining trees on its land , if it is n't allowed to chop them down .
shropshire housing agreed to delay cutting down a tree on sidney road in ludlow yesterday after complaints from councillor andy boddington .
one tree has already been felled , but mr boddington said the trees were healthy and safe and would cost little to maintain .

documents.title: nhs chief forced out by nhs england
text: it now appears the decision to replace david evans as the man in charge of shropshire 's clinicial commissioning group was made by nhs england , to make way for a specialist in turning around the ccg 's finances .
david evans will be replaced by dr simon freeman from the arden and gem commissioning support unit in leicestershire - described as a `` dedicated turnaround '' officer .
the ccg is £ 18m in deficit and that is forecast to rise to £ 31m by april if nothing is done .
the nhs says david evans will remain in charge of the telford ccg , while dr freeman 's appointment will be for the `` foreseeable future '' .
david 's appointment was always on an interim basis and it is important that we have a dedicated ao who can help shropshire tackle our financial deficit .
simon has a wealth of experience within both the nhs and private sector and we look forward to working alongside him . ''

documents.title: shropshire councillor tells of fracking fears
text: the approval of a site for the fracking of shale gas in the north of england has set a dangerous precedent for the future of the countryside , a shropshire councillor has claimed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: fundraisers close in on swimming pool target
text: fundraisers in bishop 's castle have almost hit their £ 50,000 target to help keep the town 's swimming pool open .
they 've organised a colour-run , held a sheep auction and climbed snowdon , among other things and now have £ 42,000 , which will be spent on insulating the pool , to make it cheaper to run .

the save the sparc campaign is looking for a further £ 15,000 from an energy fund , to pay for a pool cover , in the hope of making it more economical to run and therefore more attractive for potential operators .
campaigners say the sparc leisure centre is used by 71,000 people every year , but its future is in doubt because shropshire council is looking to cut the money it spends on leisure services .

documents.title: baby alpaca born at shropshire college
text: north shropshire college has had a new arrival at its walford campus - a baby alpaca .
he 's been named george and the college says that it 's great he 's been born at the start of an academic year , because new students will be able to see his development .
the college says that because of the value of his coat , a commercial farmer has already agreed to buy him , so he will only be staying there for six months .

documents.title: football : coyne does n't want shrewsbury town job
text: shrewsbury town 's caretaker manager danny coyne , says he has no interest in taking on the job full-time .
he said : `` i 'm not cut out to be a manager '' and explained `` there is a lot more to it than people think '' , saying he has seen how much is involved while working as a goalkeeping coach .
coyne is the second person to rule himself out , following former bristol city and nottingham forest manager steve cotterill .

documents.title: shropshire health boss to leave role
text: one of the key figures in shropshire 's health service is being replaced .
david evans has been running both the county 's health commissioning groups for six months , but will now go back to just being in charge at telford .
the identity of the new boss has n't been revealed .
it comes as the programme to reorganise the county 's main acute hospitals was put on hold for a month .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: former mep claims woolfe incident is 'not a one off '
text: the former west midlands ukip mep nikki sinclaire says when she was a member of the party she witnessed violent behaviour at party meetings .
and she described the confrontation yesterday , which left mep steven woolfe needing hospital treatment , as `` not very edifying '' .

ms sinclaire left the party in 2010 after a difference of opinion over the party 's direction and she said there was a lot of frustration among members , because it was a `` melting pot '' of people from different political backgrounds .
but her claims were disputed by current ukip mep roger helmer , who said he had never seen violent confrontations between ukip representatives .

documents.title: headlines : call for hospital rethink ; regimental museum to stay open ; coyne does n't want shrewsbury job
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- call for idea of new hospital site to be revived
- regimental museum to stay open despite mod funding cut
- caretaker coyne rules himself out of permanent shrewsbury town job
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : another cloudy afternoon for shropshire
text: we 're expecting more cloud across shropshire this afternoon and there will be more of the same over the weekend .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : anniversary of shropshire mammoth discovery celebrated
text: do you remember watching mark curry on blue peter 30 years ago , when he helped unearth the shropshire mammoth ?
well , that discovery is being remembered today , at the shropshire hills discovery centre .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: telford conservative calls for new hospital idea to be revived
text: the leader of the conservative group on telford and wrekin council says the government should either be asked to pay for a new hospital in the county , or to give the existing hospitals more money - so both can keep a full a & e .
councillor andrew eade was speaking at a council debate last night , which backed a motion threatening legal action if the nhs moves ahead with proposals to downgrade telford 's a & e .
the nhs has already ruled out the idea of a new hospital half-way between shrewsbury and telford , saying it would cost too much .
to a point we have to accept what is being said by professionals , but i would like to see a detailed business case put together for all the options that are facing us at the moment . ''

documents.title: football : tranmere fans delighted to get mellon
text: micky mellon 's move from shrewsbury town to tranmere rovers seems to be making the tranmere fans very happy .
when the news was officially announced last night , twitter was flooded with supporters reacting to the news .
@ twitterid wrote `` a real statement of intent '' and @ twitterid commented `` excellent appointment , well done rovers '' .

there were also tweets from shrewsbury fans wishing him good luck and even from former shrewsbury player ryan lowe , who wrote : `` that 's some appointment that well played , , , big task ahead but if any one can micky can . ''
micky mellon has tonight been appointed the new tranmere rovers manager
a real statement of intent .
well played mark and @ twitterid
micky mellon has tonight been appointed the new tranmere rovers manager
that 's some appointment that well played , , , big task ahead but if any one can micky can # swa
@ twitterid @ twitterid so would would you say this is showing the commitment you could n't see when you were a white ?
come back in jan lowey
more on micky mellon 's appointment as new tranmere manager
excellent appointment well done rovers

documents.title: mammoth anniversary celebrated
text: the 30th anniversary of the discovery of the shropshire mammoth is being marked at the shropshire hills discovery centre in craven arms .
the 14,000-year-old bones were found in a sand and gravel quarry near condover .
the original bones are now in storage but exact replicas where made and the skeleton was reassembled and it 's now on display at the discovery centre .

documents.title: regimental museum to stay open despite cut in funding
text: shropshire council has been quick to reassure people over the future of the shropshire regimental museum after the ministry of defence announced it 'll withdraw funding next year .
the mod is cutting funding for all regimental museums from next april but the council says it does n't anticipate any impact on the operation or opening hours of the regimental museum .
the council currently receives around £ 30,000 a year from the government for staff and running costs .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: cotterill wo n't be next town boss
text: the former bristol city manager steve cotterill has ruled himself out of the running to become the new shrewsbury town boss .
cotterill told bbc radio shropshire that he has a lot of respect for the club and its chairman roland wycherley but wo n't be applying for the vacancy .
he was the early bookies favourite to takeover from micky mellon who 's left to manage non-league tranmere rovers .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : museum loses funding ; council to continue hospital fight ; mammoth discovery celebrated
text: our top stories this morning :
- mod withdrawing funding from shrewsbury regimental museum
- telford and wrekin council agrees to fight hospital changes
- anniversary of mammoth discovery celebrated
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: row over a & e plans
text: the labour leader of telford and wrekin council , shaun davies has accused health bosses in shropshire of fitting facts to a preferred conclusion in the row over the future of a & e in the county .

an emergency council meeting unanimously supported a motion that would see them seek a judicial review into any decision to downgrade a & e at the princess royal hospital after an independent report suggested that one modern unit , based in shrewsbury would better serve the county .

the future fit programme has been tasked with sorting out the finances and future of healthcare in the county and no final decisions have been announced , despite the process so far taking three years and costing around £ 3m .
we were n't born yesterday , we know exactly what 's happening here .
they 've had a narrative , they 've had a destination that they wanted to get to and they 've been fitting facts and fitting stats around that to get to that narrative and it 's awful . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police failings played a part in teenager 's death
text: the shropshire coroner says lessons must be learnt following the death of a teenager who 's body was discovered in a pond near whitchurch .
tyrone lock , 18 , had taken ecstasy but an inquest concluded that significant police failings played their part .
officers were called to the hill valley hotel and golf course near whitchurch following reports of anti-social behaviour .
tyrone lock ran away wearing just his underwear .
the police asked for a helicopter to support their search , but it could n't attend due to high winds .
the jury 's verdict said that they should have asked again later .
the force says it will review procedures .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : council reacts to a & e threat , police criticised over teenager 's death
text: the stories we 're following this morning include :
- telford and wrekin council react to the threat to a & e in the town at an emergency meeting
- police told they could have done more to prevent the death of a teenager
- cotterill wo n't be the new shrewsbury town manager
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: mellon leaves shrewsbury for tranmere
text: mellon leaves shrewsbury for tranmere

documents.title: weather : a wet start but brighter later
text: a damp and drizzly start to the day with plenty of cloud around .
however , the rain should clear up as the day goes by with somethinga little brighter possible this afternoon .
highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : roadworks causing problems on a49
text: there 's congestion in both directions on the a49 between the battlefield roundabout in shrewsbury and the astley lane junction .
there are roadworks in the area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live for shropshire .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police failings in hypothermia death
text: police failings in hypothermia death

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury chief executive discusses mellon departure
text: the shrewsbury town chief executve , brian caldwell , has been talking to us this afternoon about the departure of manager micky mellon .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: on air : bbc midlands today
text: an inquest into the death of a teenager at a golf course has concluded that `` significant police failings '' contributed to his death .
also on the programme , horse racing has returned to hereford ( above ) for the first time in four years .
you can find out more on bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: cally rhodes live in session performing 'glasshouse '
text: cally rhodes live in session performing 'glasshouse '

documents.title: police respond to tyrone lock inquest verdict
text: west mercia police have been criticised for `` significant failings '' which contributed to the death of 18-year-old tyrone lock from herefordshire at a whitchurch golf course last year .

one of the criticisms was that the force were n't able to call on the support of a police helicopter to help search for the teenager when he fled into the night , wearing just a pair of boxer shorts and his socks .
the force has responded by saying : `` we acknowledge today 's verdict and we will now look to work closely with the national police air service to review future call out procedures . ''
and it added : `` our thoughts remain with the family and friends of tyrone following his tragic death . ''

documents.title: weather : a cloudy few days ahead
text: we 've had a bit of sunshine today , but that 's going to disappear and we 're in for a few cloudy days .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: parents of teenager say police let them him down
text: the father of a herefordshire teenager found dead on a shropshire golf course last november has said the police `` could have saved his life '' , but that they `` let him down '' by not finding him before he died of hypothermia .

tyrone lock , from hope-under-dinmore , had earlier fled police officers at the hill valley hotel near whitchurch and his father jim lock said `` they never acted appropriate , like they should have done '' .
an inquest found `` significant police failings '' had contributed to his death .
his mother , tracey lock , described him as a `` gentleman , loved by everybody '' and said the family felt the police should have done more to find him .
`` i 'm happy to get justice for tyrone , but [ the police ] let us down , they let tyrone down .
tyrone was in a pond for two days and we did n't even know - if they would have looked for tyrone that would have saved us all a lot of heartache and pain . ''

documents.title: latest : dead teenager 's parents say police let him down ; shrewsbury hunt new manager ; ludlow tree-felling stopped
text: our headlines this evening :
- parents of teenager who died on whitchurch golf course say police let him down
- shrewsbury begin search for a new manager
- housing group agrees to stop felling ludlow trees after complaints
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ludlow tree-felling halted
text: the shropshire housing group has agreed to stop cutting down trees in ludlow , after complaints from a local councillor .
shropshire council says the trees are on land owned by south shropshire housing association ( ssha ) , and the felling was arranged by shropshire housing group ( shg )
the authority said its tree officer has obtained a promise from shg that they will not fell the second tree until further discussions have taken place with the council .

documents.title: your photos : autumnal scenes from around shropshire
text: autumn is definitely here now and we 've been getting some great photos from the bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: coroner to write to police following teenager 's death
text: the shropshire coroner says he will write to the chief constable of west mercia police , saying lessons must be learnt from the death of a teenager at the hill valley hotel golf club near whitchurch .
an inquest jury concluded this afternoon that `` significant police failings '' contributed to the death of 18-year-old tyrone lock last november .

in a narrative verdict , the jury said the police inappropriately classed him as a suspect , rather than a vulnerable person , when he ran away from officers and that they should have made a second request for a search helicopter , when their first request was turned down .
the inquest heard mr lock died of hypothermia and that his body was not found for 48 hours .
coroner john ellery said he would also write to the national police air service , because there had been a `` clear misunderstanding '' .

documents.title: golf course inquest finds police failings contributed to tyrone lock 's death
text: an inquest into the death of a teenager at a golf course near whitchurch has concluded that `` significant police failings '' contributed to his death .
a jury in telford had heard evidence that tyrone lock , who was 18 and from herefordshire , had been taking drugs before he died .
lock had fled onto the golf course after police were called to reports he had been acting aggressively and his body was found two days later .
the inquest this afternoon recorded a narrative verdict .

documents.title: rugby and football clubs hit by raiders in bridgnorth
text: sports clubs , pubs and outbuildings have been targeted in a spate of burglaries in bridgnorth .
author: Bridgnorth Journal

documents.title: shropshire ukip politician reacts to steven woolfe collapse
text: local ukip politicians have been reacting to the news that party leadership front-runner steven woolfe is in a `` serious '' condition after an `` altercation '' at a gathering of its meps in strasbourg .
suzanne evans , from shrewsbury , is one of the other names in the frame for the party leadership job .

documents.title: tree-felling angers ludlow councillor
text: a councillor is taking emergency action to try and stop trees being cut down in ludlow .
andy boddington says workers moved on to the green space off charlton rise this morning and started felling one of two mature trees .
mr boddington says an emergency tree preservation order has been sought from the council and that he and local colleagues are `` furious '' .

documents.title: watch : sports producer james bond talks about mellon departure
text: micky mellon has left shrewsbury town to join tranmere rovers .
here 's a summary of the news so far .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: latest : mellon leaves shrewsbury town ; call for hospital review halt ; inquest jury retires
text: a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- shrewsbury town part ways with manager micky mellon
- council calls for immediate halt to hospitals review
- inquest jury retires to consider tyrone lock verdict
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town confirm mellon departure
text: shrewsbury town have confirmed the news that micky mellon has left the club , along with his assistant mike jackson .
they have also confirmed that danny coyne will be in charge for saturday 's game against bradford .
shrewsbury say they would like to thank the pair `` for all they have achieved during their times at the club '' .

documents.title: jury retires to consider tyrone lock verdict
text: the jury has retired to consider its verdict at the tyrone lock inquest in telford .
the 18-year-old was discovered in a pond at hill valley hotel near whitchurch in november , two days after police were called to reports of anti-social behaviour .
the four-day inquest in telford has heard how he 'd taken drugs , and that the police helicopter was unable to take part in the search .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: west midlands ukip mep sends best wishes to steven woolfe
text: the west midlands ukip mep , bill etheridge , says he 's wishing `` all the best '' to his fellow party mep steven woolfe ( in hospital after an apparent `` altercation '' at a meeting of the party 's meps .
nigel farage says mr woolfe is in a `` serious '' condition following the incident in strasbourg .
mr woolfe , mep for the north west , was taken to hospital in strasbourg for tests .
hoping all is well and wishing @ twitterid all the best after he was taken ill today in strasbourg
did n't you start the fight ?
no
oh .
who he fight ?
mike hookem .
steven apparently offered him outside after being called a joke .
its a very sad day for ukip , this should never of happened its embarrassing
@ twitterid not sure taken ill is the whole truth !
what 's happening to the party we all voted
still standing up for ordinary folk mate .
good answer lol
`` taken i 'll '' well that 's one way of putting it bill
look familiar ?
`` taken ill '' is a new euphemism for punched in the fucking face lmfao .
taking the people for fools

involved in a ukip brawl more like
@ twitterid `` taken ill '' ?
and you wonder why no-one trusts politicians
he got knocked the fark out
`` taken ill '' ?
is that what happened ?
your tweet was quoted in a story by @ twitterid
is it true it was bill ?
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: school-girl gets leg trapped in school fence
text: an eight-year-old girl got her leg stuck in the fence at hinstock primary school this morning .
firefighters had to be called to cut her free and she was released unhurt .

documents.title: watch : teenage poet reads poem she wrote for bbc radio shropshire
text: as it 's national poetry day we asked shropshire 's first young poet laureate to write us a poem .
mia cunningham is 17 now and is studying at a performing arts school , but grew up near wenlock edge and used the area as the inspiration for this piece , which she calls `` as they poet '' .
author: Eric and Clare's Breakfast Show

documents.title: council to call for immediate halt to hospitals plan
text: telford and wrekin council is going to call for an immediate halt to nhs plans to reorganise shropshire 's hospitals .

the authority is unhappy about a recommendation to downgrade the a & e at the princess royal hospital and move the women and children 's department to shrewsbury , and is threatening a legal challenge .

the motion going before a specially-called council meeting this evening will says `` this council deplores the recent recommendation '' and also calls for more funding to keep both the county 's a & e departments running as they are .

we call on the secretary of state for health to immediately intervene and put a permanent halt to this flawed plan and fund shropshire and telford & wrekin 's health economy sufficiently to ensure we can maintain two properly resourced a & es and retain the women 's & children 's unit at the prh . ''

documents.title: football : names in the frame to replace mellon
text: there 's an empty managerial chair at shrewsbury town , but who is going to take over for micky mellon ?
names in the frame include steve cotterill , ian holloway , kenny jackett , mark yates , steve evans , alex rae , neil redfearn , steve thompson and steven pressley .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : nursery children learn about dementia
text: a nursery school near albrighton has held an unconventional book reading to help explain the effects of dementia .
birchfield prepcare day nursery invited the children 's author lee sterry to read from her book the buttercup game .
she wrote it to help children understand what 's happening when grandparents fail to remember things .
nursery manager , penny shevyn , thinks it 's important that young children are taught , in a sensitive way , about things they may encounter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : phone-in tonight to discuss micky mellon departure
text: this evening we 'll be holding a special phone-in on bbc radio shropshire to discuss micky mellon 's expected departure to join tranmere .
where next for shrewsbury town ?
you can join adam green and me from 18:00 and call in to have your say on 01743 248321 .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: latest : mellon leaves shrewsbury town ; call for immediate halt to a & e review ; community project funding bid
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- micky mellon leaves shrewsbury town to take tranmere job
- telford and wrekin council to call for immediate halt to a & e review
- community projects bid for funding
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: farmers heading to brussels for brexit talks
text: two dozen shropshire farmers are planning a trip to brussels next month .
they 'll be part a delegation heading over to debate the effects of brexit on british agriculture .
county chairman richard yates said they want to `` facilitate a better withdrawal '' .

documents.title: weather : an overcast afternoon in shropshire
text: we had some clear skies earlier this morning , but the rest of the day is expected to be overcast .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: council 's hospital debate goes ahead as planned this evening
text: despite the decision to put a & e proposals on hold for another month , telford and wrekin council is still going ahead with its hospitals debate tonight .
the authority has been unhappy about recommendations to downgrade the a & e department at the princess royal hospital and to move the women and children 's centre to shrewsbury .
it 's going to be a public meeting at telford college , starting at 18:00 .

documents.title: your photos : a clear and chilly start to the day in shropshire
text: it 's been a clear and cold start to the day for many of us and you can almost feel the chill in the air in this photo from one of the bbc weather watchers .
it was taken near kinnersley earlier this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : coyne to take charge on saturday
text: goalkeeping coach danny coyne is expected to take over as interim shrewsbury manager this weekend .
we 're expecting a press conference at shrewsbury town this afternoon , following micky mellon 's departure .
assistant manager mike jackson has also left shrewsbury .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : mellon leaves to take tranmere job
text: we 've been told shrewsbury 's micky mellon held talks with tranmere about their vacant manager job on monday after being given permission by the club .
we believe a deal has been done and that mellon has now left the greenhous meadow .
mellon has struggled for results at shrewsbury in recent months and is a former tranmere player .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingfootball : shrewsbury manager mellon could be leaving for tranmere
text: there 's strong speculation that micky mellon could be leaving shrewsbury town .
radio shropshire understands he 's been in talks about taking over at tranmere rovers .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: community projects bid for funding
text: the sparc leisure centre in bishop 's castle is battling two village halls to get its hands on funding for a new swimming pool cover .
it 's up against dorrington village hall near shrewsbury , which wants solar panels and diddlebury village hall near craven arms , which wants the money for a refurbishment .
the projects with the most public votes will get up to £ 12,500 from the m & s energy fund .

documents.title: health officials say a & e public consultation will happen soon
text: the nhs group set up to review the future of shropshire 's hospitals is insisting that a consultation on its proposals to reorganise some departments will start before the end of year .
the future fit group had been due to make recommendations yesterday , but decided it needed more time to respond to concerns raised by telford and wrekin council .
gill george , from the campaign group defend our nhs , described the proposals as `` the cuts package that will not die '' .
a senior surgeon at the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust , mark cheetham , responded on twitter :
interested to hear gill george on @ twitterid trying to spin a £ 300 million hospital capital project as cuts !

documents.title: latest : a & e consultation to start in december ; community project funding bids ; tns boss scouting mission
text: our top stories this morning :
- consultation on a & e proposals to start in december
- community projects bid for funding
- tns boss goes on scottish scouting mission
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury firefighter will face trial
text: a former shropshire retained firefighter will face a charge of perverting the course of justice at a trial to be held next year .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: sunday politics : 'midlands engine ' and shropshire 's hospitals under the spotlight
text: sunday politics in the midlands is looking at the idea of a `` midlands engine '' to rival the `` northern powerhouse '' and asking what is behind the pr slogans .
it 's also delving into the ongoing row over shropshire a & e services and asking if the county needs two emergency departments .
the guests on the sofa this week will be the conservative mp for south staffordshire , gavin williamson , and the labour mp for wolverhampton north east , emma reynolds .
author: BBC Sunday Politics

documents.title: football : tns boss goes on forfar scouting mission
text: the new saints will travel to scotland on saturday to take on forfar athletic in the scottish irn-bru cup and tns manager craig harrison has been north of the border to watch them play .
the tournament has been shaken up this season to include the top welsh and northern irish clubs and harrison says he is keen to do well and make wales proud .
the tns manager said he travelled up to watch forfar on the saturday before the carmarthen game and has worked out a game plan .
forfar are currently top of the scottish league two , after winning seven of their eight league fixtures .

documents.title: latest : emergency care consultation to happen soon ; trial of bridgnorth man charged with causing two deaths ; nursery children learn about dementia
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at today :
- health officials say a public consultation about emergency care services in shropshire and telford will begin later this year
- the trial of a bridgnorth man charged with causing the death of two members of a cornish sea-shanty group continues
- a children 's author visits a nursery school in albrighton to read from her book about dementia
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : weather forecast for shropshire
text: variable amounts of cloud today with some bright and occasionally sunny intervals .
it 'll be cooler and a little breezy at times with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : routes around shropshire moving well
text: no major problems so far .
the delays due to roadworks continue on the a49 between shrewsbury and hadnall .
hold ups are lasting a few minutes in both directions .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: me and the team will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18:00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: mellon accepts responsibility for exit
text: mellon accepts responsibility for exit

documents.title: gig deaths accused 'casual over safety '
text: gig deaths accused 'casual over safety '

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : a clear night and some cloud tomorrow
text: we 're in for a clear night , but the cloud is expected to return tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: a & e warning from telford council leader
text: the leader of telford and wrekin council , shaun davies , is warning the `` threat to services '' at the princess royal hospital `` remains very much alive and very real '' .
it follows a move this afternoon to defer a decision on the future of a & e services in the county .
the future fit review group had been due to make recommendations , but decided it needed more time to respond to concerns about its decision-making process .
mr davies said it was important that the hospitals seek help from neighbouring areas , to make sure the two a & e departments could continue to operate , while a long-term solution was found .

the deferment by the future fit programme is exactly what we had been asking for because of the concerns we have around proper consideration of the issues at stake that would affect access to health care for all our residents .
however i must be very clear .
do n't be fooled - this issue has not gone away . ''

documents.title: metal detectorist to rescue of market drayton woman who lost her wedding ring
text: a market drayton woman has thanked a metal detectorist after he found her lost wedding ring .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: two taken to hospital after a41 crash
text: two people have been taken to hospital following the crash on the a41 near shifnal this afternoon .
the ambulance service says only three were injured in total , not eight as had been reported by the fire service earlier .
and the accident , which involved four cars , a van and a coach is expected to cause delays in the area for some time .

there are road closures in place in the area including at the king street junction with chatwell lane on the a41 , junction 5 with the a5 , the island at the a41 for the a518 and the a518 island for chetwynd aston .
the road has also been blocked at the aldi roundabout , newport .

documents.title: ukip leadership : west midlands mep bill etheridge to stand
text: west midlands ukip mep bill etheridge has confirmed he will be standing for his party 's leadership .
it comes after diane james ' decision to step down from the top job last night , after only 18 days in charge .
nigel farage is to lead the party until a fresh contest is completed .
the ukip north west mep steven woolfe has said he will stand for the leadership .
when the leadership election is called i see currently no reason whatsoever why i should n't have another crack .
unless something dramatic happens , some great heroic saviour-type figure appears , then i shall be having a go . ''
ukip nw mep steven woolfe confirms leadership bid `` we can replace labour as the main opposition and stand up for the ignored working class ''
absolutely dillusional
@ twitterid well your leaders last as long as your mp 's , so who knows , tis a funny ol world after all
author: Andrew Easton
Presenter, BBC

documents.title: hospital delay welcomed by telford council leader
text: the leader of telford and wrekin council , shaun davies , has welcomed the decision to delay a decision on hospital a & e services in the county .
but he has said it was wrong to suggest the concerns were only raised in the last 24 hours and called a statement by the future fit review team `` unhelpful '' .
he said the extra time now needs to be used to put pressure on the government for extra resources .

documents.title: football : telford fill gap in fixture list
text: afc telford united have filled the gap in their fixtures .
on 15 october their scheduled opponents brackley have an fa cup game .
the bucks have brought forward their league match at home to fc united of manchester , which was due to be played in february .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : a & e decision delayed ; eight hurt in a41 crash ; band death trial hears of metal door concerns
text: our headlines this evening :
- decision on hospital a & e departments delayed for a month
- eight hurt in multiple-vehicle crash near shifnal
- band-death trial hears metal doors had failed before fatal accident
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bridgnorth man accused of fabricating information on health and safety form
text: a bridgnorth man charged with causing the deaths of a singer and a band-manager at a gig in surrey has been accused of fabricating information on a health and safety form in order to get the contract to fit the door .

david naylor is standing trial , facing two counts of manslaughter by gross negligence after the stage door at guildford 's g live venue ( below ) fell without warning in february 2013 , crushing fisherman 's friends tour manager paul mcmullen and fatally injuring singer trevor grills .
the prosecution also said mr naylor had an `` ill disciplined '' approach to servicing contracts .
the trial is expected to last six to eight weeks .

documents.title: hospital decision delayed to deal with concerns about review process
text: the nhs future fit review group says it delayed a discussion on the future of hospital services in the county so it could deal with concerns raised about its decision-making process .
in a statement this afternoon , it said it had received specific concerns in the last 24 hours and there was n't time to respond to the points raised .
it says it hopes to respond to those concerns and then hold another board meeting in a month .

and it said it recognised this delay would be frustrating to many people , but failure to follow due process could ultimately cause further delays and it still hoped to start public consultation in december .

documents.title: eight injured in crash involving coach
text: eight people have been hurt in an crash involving a coach on the a41 near shifnal this afternoon , firefighters say .
one person had to be cut free from their vehicle .

documents.title: breakinghospital a & e decision delayed for one month
text: as expected , the nhs panel reviewing hospital services in the county has agreed to defer a decision on shropshire 's accident and emergency departments - but only for one month .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : part of a41 closed by coach crash
text: the a41 is closed between the pickmere roundabout ( to weston park and the a5 ) and the b4379 to sherrifhales , police say .
it 's because of the accident involving a coach and three other vehicles and we are told to expect delays for some time .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: your questions about shropshire
text: is there something you have always wondered about shropshire ?
ask us here and your question could be making the news .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingtwo trapped after crash involving coach near shifnal
text: two people are being cut free from their car after a crash involving a coach , on the a41 just outside shifnal .
the fire service says two other vehicles were involved and that the coach was empty .

documents.title: cricket : more children joining cricket clubs in the county
text: shropshire 's chance to shine programme to recruit more young cricketers seems to be working .
a survey of county clubs show an increasing number of youngsters are making the switch from primary and secondary school cricket programmes to their local club sides .
in the past 12 months junior programmes have recruited 802 new members , bringing the total to 1,869 .
children from key stage 1 classes made up 288 of those .

it 's absolutely vital that clubs continue to invest their resources into coach development to future-proof our game and support the junior players who have decided to make cricket their sport of choice outside of school . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : a & e decision could be delayed ; band-death trial hears of door failures ; over 900 police car accidents
text: here 's a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- nhs expected to delay hospital a & e decision
- band-death trial hears metal doors had history of failure
- more than 900 accidents involving west mercia police cars
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tesco creating 100 christmas jobs in shropshire and mid wales
text: more than 100 jobs will be created in shropshire and mid wales in the run-up to christmas by supermarket giant tesco .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : bright blue skies over the county this afternoon
text: there is hardly a cloud in the sky today and the bbc weather watchers have been sharing their photos of blue skies around the county .
this one was taken just outside church stretton just before midday .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: worker gets finger trapped in machinery
text: a worker has been freed after getting a finger trapped in machinery at the kerry ingredients factory , on the shropshire-worcestershire border .
firefighters were called to the site at burford , near tenbury wells , at 02:40 and it took half an hour to free him .
the ambulance service says he was taken to worcester royal infirmary for treatment .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: more than 900 accidents involving west mercia police cars over three years
text: there have been 949 accidents involving west mercia police cars between 2013 and 2015 .
of those , 331 involved unmarked police and they resulted in 23 injuries .
west mercia police says that its officers adhere to nationally approved driver training standards which are governed by the college of policing .

documents.title: band-death trial told of fatal injuries
text: the trial of a bridgnorth man , charged with causing the death of a singer and tour manager from the fisherman 's friends band , has been told how they died .
the prosecution told the jury at guildford crown court that a two-tonne metal door fell on them when chains connecting the motor to a drive shaft disconnected .
tour manager paul mcmullen ( right ) was trapped by his legs and died at the scene , while singer trevor grills ( left ) was hit on the head and died two days later in hospital .

the pair had been unloading equipment for a concert in guildford and the prosecution have said that 57-year-old david naylor , who ran express hi-fold doors ltd , could have prevented the accident by fitting an anti-drop safeguard .
the trial continues .

documents.title: shrewsbury 's suzanne evans back in the running to lead ukip after diane james resignation shock
text: shrewsbury politician suzanne evans is among the frontrunners to lead ukip after the shock resignation of leader diane james after just 18 days in charge .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : behind the scenes of an online giant 's recruitment drive
text: as the online retailer amazon launches a recruitment drive to find 4,500 workers for its staffordshire centre , we 'll be getting a rare look behind the scenes .
the staff are wanted because the internet giant says it needs to meet demand over the christmas break .
i 'll have more on midlands today from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Sarah Falkland
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: first race of the autumn season at ludlow
text: it 's the first meeting of the autumn season at ludlow racecourse today .

simon sherwood , the clerk of the course , said they 'd been doing a lot of watering , because the grass is still growing and is taking a lot of moisture out of the ground - and they do n't want it too dry .
the prize money on offer today is £ 69,000 and the going is good to firm and good in places .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : a & e decision faces delay ; band-death trial told of previous failures ; footbridge could be replaced
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- decision on future of hospital a & es likely to be delayed
- band-death trial hears metal doors had failed before
- shrewsbury footbridge might have to be replaced
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: gps meet at cancer conference
text: about 80 gps and 50 practice nurses from across telford and wrekin are gathering today for a conference on the early diagnosis of cancer .
the national lead for cancer prof mike harrison is the keynote speaker at the event at the whitehouse hotel in telford this afternoon .
organisers say the public should be reassured that local gps are committed and supported by additional training to recognise and refer cancers as early as possible .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : tns beat bala in the cup
text: a couple of goals from alex darlington were enough for tns to progress to the next round of the welsh league cup .
they beat bala town 2-1 at home in a competition they have won for the past two seasons .
next-up for tns is forfar athletic in the irn bru cup .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : a sunny afternoon in shropshire
text: we 're expecting a sunny afternoon in shropshire , with temperatures around 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: breakinghospitals decision expected to be delayed again
text: health bosses are expected to defer a decision today on the preferred option for the future of shropshire 's main acute hospitals .
it would have meant the possible downgrading of either the shrewsbury or telford a & e unit and the creation of a new emergency centre .
but bbc radio shropshire has been told that decision has been put on hold because of a legal challenge from telford and wrekin council .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: band-death trial hears metal doors had failed before
text: a man accused of causing the death of a band member and their tour manager killed by a falling two-tonne door has previously made doors that failed , his trial has heard .
singer trevor grills , 54 , and tour manager paul mcmullen , 44 , from cheshire died at an event in surrey in 2013 .
david naylor , 57 , from bridgnorth , faces two counts of manslaughter by gross negligence .
the door was made by express hifold doors ltd based in staffordshire and owned and controlled by david naylor .

the prosecution allege mr naylor knew there was a serious risk of a door such as this falling , because of the previous incidents and that the lack of an anti-drop device amounted to gross negligence manslaughter .
the trial continues .

documents.title: mellon will `` battle on '' despite pressure
text: the shrewsbury town manager micky mellon says he 'll continue to fight for his job and to turn the struggling team 's fortunes around .
the town are out of the checkatrade trophy after losing 2-0 at scunthorpe last night and they 've now gone six games without a win in all competitions .
mellon has come under ever increasing pressure from the club 's supporters in recent weeks but remains defiant .
i 'm tough and i 'll continue to try and be the best that i can everyday , wo n't feel sorry for myself , i 'll keep battling on and we 'll see what happens . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: footbridge could be replaced if repair-cost too high
text: a new footbridge might have to be built to replace shrewsbury 's castle walk footbridge , if the costs of repairing it end up being too high , shropshire council says .
the authority is planning to carry out investigation work later in the month to see how feasible it would be to repair the bridge .

it will come down to an economic judgement , in which we will balance the cost of any necessary repair or maintenance and the projected additional life that would give , against the cost of a replacement bridge and the life that would have . ''

documents.title: inquest continues into death of teenager at golf club
text: the inquest continues today into the death of herefordshire teenager tyrone lock at a whitchurch golf club .

yesterday , police dog handler pc ian willes gave evidence and explained how he tracked tree-lines and water areas for 40 minutes , and at one point heard a voice shouting `` leonard '' - the name of lock 's friend .

pc willes said the police dog up a scent though it could n't be determined if it was tyrone 's and the jury heard that pc willes had unwittingly searched near to the pond where tyrone lock 's body was found two days later .
the jury has been asked to consider whether west mercia police took appropriate action in their search for tyrone .

documents.title: mep 'not ruling out ' another bid to be ukip leader
text: the west midlands ukip mep bill etheridge says he 's not ruling out another bid to become the party 's leader .
mr etheridge missed out in the last leadership election to diane james , who has announced she 's resigning after 18 days in the role .
nigel farage has said he is still technically leader but has told the bbc he wo n't be contesting any future leadership contest and mr etheridge says that 's what he 's been told as well .

i had a fairly forthright conversation with him [ nigel farage ] about this earlier and i 'm very much assured that he wo n't be standing again although to be honest with you i wish he 'd never stood down . ''
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury footbridge could need strengthening
text: the castle walk footbridge in shrewsbury is going to be examined , to see if it needs strengthening .
shropshire council says it 's looking at the need for `` long term maintenance '' and that `` a number of issues have been identified , which will need to be addressed within the next few years '' .
the authority is having these examinations carried out between 17 and 28 october and it will involve drilling into the ground and severn bank closing to traffic for a couple of days .

documents.title: headlines : nhs bosses meet to discuss hospitals ; footbridge could need repairs ; shrewsbury manager to 'battle on '
text: our top stories this morning :
- nhs bosses to hold meeting behind closed doors to discuss hospitals reorganisation
- footbridge in shrewsbury could need repairs
- shrewsbury town manager says he will `` keep battling on '' after latest defeat
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: raf museum prepares room for more aircraft
text: with six new aircraft to arrive at the raf museum at cosford between now and christmas , there is some reshuffling going on .

the de havilland venom fb4 , fma ia58 pucara and folland gnat f1 have been put into storage and the museum says it is also looking at `` long-term plans for the site '' to ensure they can display all future arrivals undercover .

documents.title: market drayton woman with knife 'saw red mist ' during attack on husband
text: a wife who `` brandished '' a knife and threatened her husband at their market drayton home after she saw `` red mist '' has been given a six-month conditional discharge .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : health managers meet to discuss a & e ; mellon will 'keep battling '
text: some of our main stories this morning :
- health bosses are due to meet later today to decide their preferred option for the future of the county 's main acute hospitals
- more evidence will be given at the inquest into the death of a teenager , found on a golf-course in whitchurch , last november
- the shrewsbury town manager micky mellon says he 'll `` keep battling on '' after his team lost at scunthorpe
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : accident on a49
text: there 's been an accident on the a49 in shrewbsury at sundorne island and it 's slow further north on the same road at astley lane in hadnall due to roadworks .
there 's also congestion on new trench road at the clocktower roundabout in telford due to roadworks there .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: it 'll be dry today with somebright and sunny spells .
it 'll be breezy at times with variable amounts of cloud .
highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: good morning from bbc local live for shropshire .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to comment or tell us something you know , you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy night , but plenty of sunshine tomorrow
text: it is forecast to be cloudy tonight , but we should get plenty of sunshine tomorrow .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter
